document.title: My Side Walking Tall: A Person with Schizophrenia on a Journey to Better Health
document.abstract: Recent pharmacological advances have improved quality of life for many people with schizophrenia, but the use of these medications also puts people with this disease at great risk for obesity and its associated comorbidities. Although the health benefits and low cost of exercise interventions are well known, providing such interventions to people with schizophrenia presents many challenges for clinicians.
document.publication-title: Faculty Publications and Other Works -- Nursing

field.name: custom_citation
field.value: Beebe, L.H. (2006). Walking Tall: A person with schizophrenia on a journey to better health. Journal of Psychosocial Nursing and Mental Health Services, 44(6), 1-4.
